hypothesis_content.title: Stress Regime Catalyst Overreaction Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: In a STRESS market regime (as defined by the engine), an initial >8% negative price reaction to a macro/news catalyst will be partially reversed (>50% retracement of the initial move) within the next 5 trading days, as forced selling exhausts and opportunistic buyers step in.
hypothesis_content.rationale: STRESS regimes are characterized by panic and liquidity gaps. Sharp, news-driven drops often overshoot due to stop-loss cascades and margin calls. Once this forced selling abates, the absence of sellers and presence of value buyers creates a strong but temporary rebound.
entry_conditions: A significant negative catalyst occurs (e.g., regulatory news, macro shock)
BTC price drops >8% within a 24-hour period on the news
Enter on the first 4-hour candle close where RSI(14) crosses back above 30

exit_conditions.take_profit: 50% retracement of the initial 24-hour catalyst-driven drop
exit_conditions.stop_loss: New low below the initial reaction low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price continues to trend down after entry, failing to retrace more than 25% of the initial drop, indicating the catalyst has fundamentally changed the market structure.
